headline: Work Therapy Creed ✦
description: A self-authored code of conduct written as both prayer and practice. The Work Therapy Creed sanctifies discipline through gentleness — a vow to act, listen, move, and endure. It frames recovery not as escape but engagement, embodying moral repair through small faithful repetitions.

motifMap.meaning: The star of focus — steady guidance through disciplined effort.
Moral structure written as promise — belief through repetition.
Labor as sanctification — embodied therapy and moral reform.
Persistence of faith amid exhaustion — illumination through duty.
Childlike trust in divine timing — the still strength of waiting.
